snippet: Kuwait’s ruler reappointed the former prime minister on Thursday just days after his resignation, a step that could at least temporarily sideline opposition Islamists.
abstract: Kuwait’s ruler reappoints the former prime minister, Sheik Jaber al-Hamad al-Sabah, just days after his resignation, a step toward the formation of a new government that could at least temporarily sideline opposition Islamists.
lead_paragraph: Kuwait’s ruler reappointed the former prime minister on Thursday just days after his resignation, a step that could at least temporarily sideline opposition Islamists.

headline.main: Kuwait: Emir Tries to Break Stalemate
headline.print_headline: Kuwait: Emir Tries to Break Stalemate
